Introduction.name: 引言
Introduction.text:
二十二个可直接置入你战役的巢穴已经到来。每个巢穴都是一位独特反派的家园，充斥着喽啰、危险、陷阱，以及藏有独特奖励的宝藏库。每个巢穴都经过优化，旨在为五个特定等级的角色提供有趣的挑战，该等级会在巢穴描述及“按等级排列的巢穴”表格中注明。

巢穴按挑战难度升序排列。

地图

每个巢穴都附有一张地图，其上标明了所有隐藏信息，如陷阱和密门。这些地图的数字版本（以及不包含秘密的玩家版本）已随本书的购买一并提供。

基本方位

大多数巢穴地图都包含一个罗盘方位图，即使该地点位于平凡世界以外的位面也是如此。@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00best01.JournalEntryPage.00bestiary000000#the-timescape]{时间境}的大多数位面同时也是圆形星球，因此它们有北、南、东、西之分。但对于极少数没有基本方位的位面，仍会包含罗盘方位图以便于解读地图。

@Embed[inline Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.Eo4nBFtBfUvHFXB9]

区域描述

每个巢穴区域都以概述房间最重要特性的要点开始，为你提供运行该区域所需的所有前置信息。其中一些信息旨在与玩家分享，而另一些则仅供DM参考，具体如下：

  • “如果你看到像这样带引号的描述，当角色首次进入该区域时——前提是他们能正常感知周围环境——请向玩家朗读或诠释该描述。这段文字描述了角色立即注意到的事物。”
  • (如果角色在Y区域做了X…) “如果一段引文以此类括号内的条件开头，则仅当这些条件适用时，才向玩家朗读或诠释该引文。”
  • (秘密) 如果要点以此括号内的小标题开头，切勿大声读出！此描述包含给DM的信息，在角色进一步调查该区域之前，不应向玩家透露。隐藏的生物、陷阱等可能以此方式呈现。

每张地图上，房间都在地图上放置了注释。建议DM开启注释显示功能；为此，请进入 日志注释层域，并确保 切换注释显示已启用。

宝藏库

巢穴的大部分宝藏都位于巢穴末尾列出的宝藏库中。每个宝藏库都包含一件独特的魔法或灵能物品，以及另一项独特奖励，例如一种新毒素的配方。

未包含在宝藏库中的宝藏则散布在整个巢穴中。这些宝藏出现在其所在区域的“宝藏”小标题下。

本模组中的许多冒险都包含增强器，可帮助你查看队伍的被动技能。这要求队伍已设置一个队伍角色。为此，请在右侧的 角色目录中创建一个“队伍”类型的新角色，然后将玩家角色拖放进去。确保该队伍角色也设置为“队伍”。

完成后，右键单击该队伍角色并选择“ 设为主要队伍”选项。现在，当你将鼠标悬停在增强器上时，就能轻松看到谁通过了被动检定的DC！你可以通过查看谁有 [[/skill perception 20 passive format=long]] 来测试它。

作为额外的好处，此队伍角色也可以是奖励增强器的目标，充当队伍的集体资金。例如，你可以点击此处授予队伍或单个角色一枚铜币：[[/award 1cp]]。

New Psionic Powers.name: 新灵能之力
New Psionic Powers.text:
扮演异能者职业的角色——该职业出自MCDM增刊《异能者与灵能》——可以使用该书中的规则，从本书的生物处学习以下新异能。未收录于《异能者与灵能》的异能将在本节列出。

请注意，部分资料卡异能的效果与下方为玩家角色提供的版本有所不同，这通常是因为生物与生俱来的灵能天赋强化了其异能效果。

何为异能？

异能是显能者从体内抽取能量创造的特定灵能效果。这种非凡工具能解决问题、杀伤敌人、护佑己身与盟友，但也会汲取你的生命能量。驾驭这份馈赠的英雄仅凭意念与肉身能量，便可令物体凌空飞射、传递心灵讯息、操纵时间流转，乃至重塑周遭世界。

异能愈是强大，从你身上汲取的能量便愈多。所有异能皆分1至6阶。异能阶位越高，研习与施展的难度便越大。

叙乌尔君主

Elementals.name: 元素生物
Elementals.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00elementals0000 inline]

智慧元素生物

本节介绍的是作为团体共同生活和战斗的智慧元素生物。其他被称为"微尘"的元素生物也存在于时域中,但本书篇幅有限未能收录。那些元素生物的智慧程度低于此处介绍的这些。

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.Nf78IjySOtB2bgU8 cite=false]

火焰核心

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00cruxoffire0000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.KQilUzK32PPr5Fzk]

冰霜核心

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-wwhere-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00cruxoffrost000 inline]

元素魔法物品

本节介绍的元素生物偏爱那些能让他们召唤元素同伴的魔法物品,例如控制气元素香炉或元素宝石。这些物品召唤出的盟友可以立即获得召唤者的增强,从而提高了这些物品对使用它们的元素生物的价值和效果。如果盟友对某种伤害类型免疫,一些元素生物也可能使用能创造伤害性区域效果的物品。例如,一支由几个火焰核心和火焰火花组成ishkrar的铁之力,可以毫无顾忌地使用火球项链或流星戒指的流星射击效果,而不必担心伤害盟友。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.WDlcBehJ41Ms0OlK]

迷雾精华

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00essenceofmis00 inline]

风暴精华

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00essenceofsto00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.qebXpgzxAELZebbL]

潮汐精华

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00essenceoftid00 inline]

内容警告: 血液和窒息

血之力,血总管和迷雾精华会操纵敌人的血液和呼吸。如果您或您的任何玩家对血液或窒息的描述感到不适,您可能需要避免使用这些元素生物,或重新描述它们的能力。

血之力

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00forceofblood00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.LLwjBaHrjqYoMAz7]

大地之力

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00forceofearth00 inline]

第五元素的时域指数为1.86,使其有资格成为低层世界,仅比第一多元宇宙的能量略高。由于这两个多元宇宙会产生相长干涉,第五元素的居民经常显现在第一多元宇宙上,许多人都将其视为家园。元素生物的存在可能表明附近存在双位区域。

— 遗存者

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.77SRIpPi73G29aHY]

铁之力

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00forceofiron000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.mDSJZXoCggtKbeyI]

利用免疫特性

元素生物拥有伤害和状态免疫,这使它们能够在大多数凡人无法生存的环境中筑巢。例如,一个冰霜核心,一个大地之力和一个铁之力可以一起栖息在充满有毒霉菌的地下洞穴中,因为它们都对毒素伤害和中毒状态免疫。

它们并非邪恶。它们是先驱者。你会在世界之间的壁垒非常薄弱的地方找到它们——还有其他东西会与它们一同穿过屏障。

— 德梅尔扎女士,追猎者

风暴先知

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00oracleofstor00 inline]

生长原理

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00principleofg00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.eBikl2wScC2JAUqu]

火花

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00sparks00000000 inline]

日光枢纽

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00sunlightnexu00 inline]

阿塔希亚,灰烬女王

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00atshiaqueeno00 inline]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.xGvYKPicZJXS2ebd cite=false]

元素集会

每个元素生物都有一个名为集会的附赠动作,这使得它们在与元素类型的其他生物合作时最为强大。这包括本书此节中未收录的一些生物,例如@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00envi01.JournalEntryPage.00cave0000000000]环境中的化石密文生物。当您构建包含元素生物的遭遇时,请特别注意它们的附赠动作选项。这样,当先攻掷出时,您就已经知道每个元素生物可以如何帮助它们的盟友。

许多元素生物每天只能使用一次或两次它们的集会。最好在遭遇开始时使用这些选项,而不是等待战斗的后续轮次,因为元素生物可能在有机会做它们酷炫的事情之前就死亡了。

您可以通过将一个集会替换为另一个来创建独特的元素生物。例如,您可以通过将该生物的空气集会替换为大地之力的土之集会,来创造一个注入了空气和大地特性的风暴精华。您甚至可以将该生物重命名为沙暴精华。

当您交换两个元素生物的集会时,请密切关注每个生物的挑战等级。您可能希望调整伤害,豁免DC和其他效果的数值,以更好地匹配您正在使用的资料卡。查看该生物原始的集会以获得一些目标数值。

元素侍从和伴日

本书介绍了两个完全智慧的侍从元素生物(与此节中的大多数其他元素生物一样)。土元素伴日是一个更传统的元素生物,可能被施法者召唤来充当护卫魔;因此它们更适合作为伴日。

资料卡

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.XbcJcwIXwlxrmJER]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.il2X8TDDLzK9Vqa7]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.je7pY0YMVtJu72fO]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.wF7pw46T0QytOnKU]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.JOjo9mVwOijfUe09]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.vT3oHvMASf8eTZvA]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.WtpGZJ4PIEvzGLG6]

侍从

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.KMQrBgloSBrVgG3I]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.509jdZD8C4yWG7W0]

伴日

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.f2aojkTipyikgR0N]

元素生物外观

平凡世界中的元素生物呈现出由其他元素构成的生物形态。

空气火花. 空气火花是一缕云彩,呈现出有翼蛇的形状。

大地火花. 大地火花是由大块泥土和石头形成的犀牛。

迷雾精华. 迷雾精华具有披着斗篷的类人生物的朦胧轮廓。当它们攻击时,手中会形成一把残忍的武器,使受害者无法呼吸。

风暴精华. 风暴精华由编织成大型鹰或隼轮廓的彩色云状条纹构成。

潮汐精华. 潮汐精华看起来像一条闪闪发光的蓝色蝠鲼鱼,在陆地上滑行如同在水中一样轻松。

血之力. 血之力可能被误认为是一个完全被黑红色带齿护甲覆盖的巨大类人生物,但实际上,它们的"护甲"是变黑,粗糙的肉体,点缀着沸腾的红色血管。

大地之力. 大地之力类似于一个由粗糙石头形成的九尺高大猿。

铁之力. 铁之力显现为一个由可锻金属制成的四臂人马,头部形状像一个空的骑士头盔。

风暴先知. 风暴先知呈现出由雷暴云形成的风暴巨人形态。

日光枢纽. 作为纯粹光辉的存在,日光枢纽很容易被误认为是由彩色玻璃制成的有翼天族。

水火花. 水火花是由水形成的章鱼。

Giants.name: 巨人
Giants.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00giants00000000 inline]

丘陵巨人

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00hillgiants0000 inline]

@embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.C1F7E0ikQRuTx72Z]

让玩家知晓：分心

丘陵巨人的分心特质为玩家角色提供了娱乐机会,让他们可以运用"嘿,看这边!"的战术。但只有当玩家了解该特质如何运作时,他们才能享受这种乐趣,因此请务必与他们分享这一信息。

石巨人

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00stonegiants000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.e1I4XDuiZKsZhmU6]

众石成盟

由不同岩石构成的石巨人在战争时期会结为盟友。这些巨人明白他们在战斗中的技能可以相互补充。大理石巨人会与玄武岩和花岗岩巨人并肩作战。在和平时期,不同的石巨人团体会分享符文魔法的新秘密并相互贸易。

这可能会让你想要比本书中三种更多的石巨人。你可以通过取用本节中非石巨人的资料卡,赋予其石巨人的假象形态和石肤特质,并使其对非精金普通攻击的钝击,穿刺和挥砍伤害具有抗性,来创建新的石巨人资料卡。然后选择一种你认为适合新资料卡的石头类型,就完成了!例如,你可以修改火巨人红拳来创建一个黑曜石巨人,或者使用霜巨人风驰者来制作一个锆石巨人。

巨人巢穴

巨人巢穴中充满了适合15尺以上生物使用的服饰,家具,工具,武器甚至宝藏。巨人巢穴的内部应该让玩家感觉他们的角色在从一个新的视角 navigating 熟悉的环境(如蜜酒大厅)时缩小了。通常微不足道的活动,比如从桌子上拿起一个护符,变成了需要计划,准备和承担身体伤害风险的艰巨任务!这种节奏的变化非常有趣。

你可以使用以下指南来帮助你在巨人巢穴中创建挑战。

天花板. 巨人巢穴中的天花板应至少20尺高,以便巨人有充足的空间移动而无需挤过。

攀爬家具. 角色可以通过成功的[[/skill athletics 15]]检定攀爬巨人巢穴中的一件家具。

门口和走廊. 巨人巢穴中的门口和走廊应至少15尺宽,以便巨人可以舒适地在走廊中移动而无需挤过。如果多个巨人居住在巢穴中,考虑使走廊更宽以同时容纳多个巨人。同样,门口应至少15尺高。

巨人药水. 巨人尺寸的药水在更多液体中含有等量的魔法。中型或更小的生物必须使用三个动作来消耗药水。药水在用于消耗它的第三个动作后生效。如果用于消耗药水的动作之间间隔超过1分钟,药水将失去魔法并无效果。

巨人卷轴. 卷轴必须展开才能阅读。中型或更小的生物可以作为一个动作展开巨人尺寸的卷轴。

物件尺寸和重量. 为巨人尺寸的物件通常具有相当于人类同类两到三倍的尺寸,重量约为八倍。在巨人巢穴中使用负重规则有助于角色计算他们能携带多少个霜巨人首领的金质半身像。

开门. 大型,中型和小型生物可以作为一个动作打开巨人巢穴中的门。微型生物无法打开这些门。如果门是闩上或锁上的,门闩或锁离地10尺高。中型或更小的角色可以通过成功的[[/skill athletics 17]]检定爬上去。

楼梯. 巨人巢穴中的楼梯对中型和更小的生物算作困难地形。

陷阱. 巨人经常制造旨在阻挡其他敌对巨人和较小种族的陷阱。因此,他们的陷阱通常影响更大的区域。他们的火焰喷射器比类人生物陷阱射得更宽更高,他们的陷坑更深,他们的镰刀在多个高度切割。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.tFnWredrSzBLkRY5]

Gnolls.name: 豺狼人
Gnolls.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00gnolls00000000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.E9WduBkA8NrNycts]

狂暴兽群还是狡诈杀手?

你游戏中的豺狼人敌人可能是一群恶魔般的士兵,他们疯狂地冲入战场,与第一个看到的敌人{至死方休}战斗,然后转向下一个受害者。在这种情况下,豺狼人几乎不关心自身安全,更不用说保护盟友了,他们满怀着嗜血欲望投入混战。这种策略对于数量{势不可挡}的豺狼人协同作战效果很好,让你的{玩家}感觉到他们的{角色}正在对抗无情的兽群。

你也可以让豺狼人反派在实施暴力时更加精于算计。一小队豺狼人可能会运用狡猾的{战术},等到夜晚悄悄接近{角色},放火掩护撤退,并集中火力攻击对其胜利威胁最大的敌人。这些豺狼人以恶魔般的狡诈组成了凝聚力强的团队。

深渊多头蛇蜥

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00abyssalhyena00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.aVuaJMCO8yEGLXoj]

獠牙{恶魔}

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00tuskerdemons00 inline]

噬魂{恶魔}

獠牙{恶魔}拥有特殊{特性},比如灵魂视觉以及忘川和噬魂者{特质},这些在@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00best01.JournalEntryPage.00demons00000000]{恶魔}条目中有详细说明。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.PJcMthILja0lZ5kH]

豺狼人{魔法物品}

许多豺狼人并不介意使用{诅咒缠身}的{魔法物品},只要它们也能带来一些{效益},比如{狂战士}斧或{恶魔}{护甲}。他们也喜欢使用能够摧毁大片敌人和{物件}的{魔法物品},比如{力场}珠或{粉碎音波}的{法术卷轴}。

豺狼人珍视任何能提升其攻击能力的物品,使用任何能到手的{魔化武器}或{锐锋之油}{小瓶}。如果某件物品能造成{伤害}或让人更可能{命中}{攻击},那么豺狼人就想使用它,无论该物品的来源如何。

豺狼人的笑声

像多头蛇蜥一样,豺狼人在面对{风险}时会发出类似人类咯咯笑的声音。当这种声音在黑夜的{黑暗术}中随风传来时,可能是在豺狼人袭击之前令人毛骨悚然的警告。如果你的{玩家}喜欢在战斗前有一点紧张期待感,可以描述或模仿豺狼人的笑声,注意其音量随着敌人越来越近而增大。你也可以在网上找一段多头蛇蜥笑的视频放给他们听。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.q5ufgz8A8hZB1vpo]

内容警告: 蜘蛛

战争蜘蛛是体型巨大的蜘蛛! 如果你或你队伍中的任何玩家不喜欢描述窸窣爬行的蜘蛛, 在叙述与该生物相关的场景时无需深入细节. 你也可以将战争蜘蛛替换为另一种生物, 比如具有粘性唾液的战蜥.

战争蜘蛛

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00warspider00000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.LTlPI87P2SUWe8pq]

巴格诺特女王

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00queenbargnot00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.qS9lfWkZHAC39XXY]

地精和魔法物品

地精强盗有时会掠夺能辅助其职业的魔法物品. 地精身手敏捷, 灵活, 能受益于增强其他能力的魔法物品, 比如智力头带或巨人力量药水. 赋予新能力的物品, 例如飞天扫帚或心灵遥控戒指, 能造就令人难忘, 出人意料的地精遭遇战. 足够幸运拥有一批治疗药水的地精, 常常会在其中混入一瓶剧毒药水来惩罚贪婪的窃贼.

地精战术

地精受益于在具有可供攀爬和躲藏的地形特征的环境中战斗, 例如树木和柱子. 狡黠特性意味着专注于近战的地精可以冲入战斗, 攻击, 然后与盟友重新集结. 这也允许地精仆从绕过敌方武者, 包围他们的施法敌人以利用其微刺特性. 进行远程战斗的地精会攀爬以获得更好的视线和防御.

如果明显输掉战斗, 地精通常不会留下来战斗到最后一名武者. 相反, 他们会逃往蛮荒之地和狭窄隧道, 利用其天生的敏捷性奔跑和躲藏以避开威胁. 侥幸逃生的地精会花时间舔舐伤口, 然后集结更多盟友, 以崭新, 压倒性的数量冲回来面对威胁.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.HP9Qtc9TcUlhk83B]

地精和座狼

地精兽心者常常与座狼形成特殊的牵绊——许多地精群落将这种犬类生物培育为坐骑, 护卫魔和伙伴.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.rC7CdOV5U4hqrMlY]

内容警告: 溺水

在使用海鬼婆前,请与你的团队确认是否有人对溺水或窒息的描述感到不适。如果是这样,你可以将鬼婆的干涸溺水动作描述为影响陆地生物的眩晕咒语,而不是将其描述为溺水,以保持游戏的趣味性。

鸟妖和蔓生怪

当冒险者看起来不会轻易束手就擒时,鸟妖巢穴可能会试图将猎物引向蔓生怪的血盆大口。鸟妖们可以在食肉植物的上空吟唱魅惑之歌,同时保持在蔓生怪的触及范围之外。那些抵抗音乐的人会失去盟友,并被鸟妖们解决掉。

有些鸟妖巢穴为蔓生怪提供了如此多的餐点,以至于它们可以与这种植物互动而毫无风险。蔓生怪变成了一个巨大的宠物,保护着巢穴,甚至通过从它们的吞噬麻袋中喷出半消化的受害者来分享餐点,供鸟妖们享用。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.H49vb1JuoeWKROdT]

血铸武器

许多大地精铁匠会为每个士兵量身打造武器,在物品制造过程中使用一滴该战士的血液。当大地精挥舞用自己鲜血锻造的武器时,就能驾驭其内在的魔法。此类武器可以燃起火焰或荡漾负能量,造成额外的火焰或暗蚀伤害(已包含在资料卡中)。

如果其他生物试图使用血铸武器,它仅能作为普通武器使用而不具备这些额外伤害特性。根据DM的判断,由其他生物使用的血铸武器可以在接下来使用该武器进行的1d4次攻击中造成额外伤害。当力量以这种方式耗尽后,该武器将不再为除原主大地精外的任何生物造成额外伤害。

大地精魔法物品

大地精已经使用血铸武器,因此他们倾向于寻找能提升防御能力的物品,例如精金护甲或活化护盾。他们重视忠诚,并使用能召唤服从盟友的物品,比如惊奇力量雕像或召唤元素生物的法术卷轴。许多大地精队长理解俘虏的战略重要性,因此他们可能使用捆缚铁索甚至铁封印壶来对付那些特别强大且来自异界的敌人。

大地精部队通常携带大量治疗药水来医治伤员。战前,搬运工会在营地周围展示药水瓶,提醒士兵们致命伤可以通过快速饮用来治愈。这种做法鼓励部队在战斗中承担更多风险。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.a7NV21jHUlUtCyos]

人类魔法物品

人类能受益于充分利用其"利用破绽"特性的魔法物品。需要攻击命中才能触发的魔法物品词条,例如淬毒匕首或公羊之戒,由人类持用时效果更佳,因为"利用破绽"特性提供了更高的命中机会。同样,在攻击检定掷出20时触发的魔法物品词条,例如恶毒武器或斩首剑,与"利用破绽"特性结合后更易展现其酷炫效果。在为反派装备斩首剑前,请确保你的玩家喜欢致命游戏,因为一次幸运攻击就可能让英雄身首异处!

因其与平凡世界的独特联系而正式被称为泰拉人,人类与其造物神并无直接关联。

— 遗民

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.CFQ1ci0t8JEokOEq]

调整学徒法师

人类法师常遵循奥秘传统来精通特定魔法元素。在此资料卡中,学徒法师使用闪电打击和雷鸣爆裂攻击,但DM可通过将两种伤害类型改为强酸,冷冻或火焰伤害来体现不同的元素专精。法师只有在群体攻击造成相同伤害类型时才能加入其他法师的群体攻击。

人类元素法师

人类法师常遵循奥秘传统来精通特定魔法元素。作为DM,您可通过调整@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.bsr3MCfh7Pc1lzjU]资料卡来引入新的元素法师,如下列示例所示。

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.2Za4Bi5QTSlMkng0]。法师的奥秘法杖动作和奥秘护盾反应造成冷冻伤害而非闪电和雷鸣伤害。此外,法师不施放闪电束法术,而是施放冰风暴。

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.Oz7jcrNVzeo8FKeU]。法师的奥秘法杖动作和奥秘护盾反应造成火焰伤害而非闪电和雷鸣伤害。此外,法师不施放造风术法术,而是施放炽焰法球,且不施放闪电束,而是施放火球术。

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00shieldscaled00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.GtPs7UYClj4Jyj43]

致命的狗头人!

本书中的狗头人专为协同作战而设计。我们在游戏测试中发现,这些小蜥蜴配合得有点太好了,它们屠杀了数十名玩家角色。因此,我们大幅削弱了狗头人的实力,但一队这样的小型龙类对脆弱的1环角色来说仍然是 formidable 的力量。对1环法师的一次不幸重击就足以宣告那位英雄的末日。

当让这些狗头人对抗1环队伍时,请使用挑战等级为1或更低的狗头人(除非你想让情况变得致命)。把工匠和盾鳞龙裔留到下次冒险再用!我们还建议在单次遭遇中使用的非喽啰狗头人数量不要超过队伍角色数量。如果你想让1环角色与整支狗头人军团作战,那就是新兵种该出场的时候了。

哦,这提醒了我们,如果你想参与未来MCDM产品的游戏测试,看看我们接下来会创造什么致命生物,请加入我们的Discord社区,访问mcdm.gg/discord。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.LuFvRciwshuBvsyk]

运作工匠

如果工匠在角色到达时就已经在战场上等候,它们的诡计就更可信了——这个想法是工匠在触发它们早已设置好的陷阱。它们如何触发陷阱由你决定。它们可以抛出链钩拉动隐藏的杠杆,使用魔杖或机械装置,甚至向在战场下方隧道中劳作的其他狗头人喊出命令。

你可以通过给工匠配备能将角色推入陷阱的盟友,或将战斗安排在狭窄区域使陷阱更可能击中多个角色,来增加遭遇的难度。

你可以通过缩小陷阱尺寸,将陷阱放置在预定区域并允许角色进行属性检定来发现它们,或将战斗安排在角色可以分散的开阔区域,来降低遭遇的难度。

如果角色胆敢在狗头人军团自己的巢穴中挑战它们,工匠就是防御战的绝佳领袖。给工匠一种能看清整个巢穴的方式,比如镜子网络,并允许它们在巢穴内的任何地方触发陷阱。

巢穴让你可以部署在开阔战斗中不合理的陷阱,例如:

  • 绊线触发巨石沿走廊滚下。
  • 熔岩池上方的绳索和对岸等待割断绳索的隐藏狗头人。
  • 隐藏着几只@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.HB3gb6h57Nh1UDjr]{血生泥怪}的血池。
  • 迷宫般的走廊和移动的假墙,使角色迷失方向并将他们引向伏击。

维护崇高标准

没有军团会让他们荣耀煊赫的军旗被敌人践踏在脚下。当旗手死亡时,最近的新兵会冲向尸体捡起军旗。如果敌人捡起军旗或伤害它,狗头人会将攻击集中在该生物身上。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.pGdbd7dzqD4cJ6M8]

狗头人魔法物品

由于狗头人靠数量取胜,他们受益于能让他们远距离私下交流的魔法物品,例如法术卷轴的传讯术或短讯术。他们也喜欢能让他们同时惠及多个盟友并保持团体行动的物品,例如折叠船或瞬时堡垒。

虽然许多史诗英雄携传奇武器参战,但狗头人勇士的盾牌几乎与挥舞它的武者齐名。使用魔法盾牌的狗头人通常是声名显赫,闻名遐迩的武者。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.T9xzdPxVfXWfOhwY]

你披着谁的皮毛？

蜥蜴人战术

蜥蜴人偏好在水域中与敌人交战，因为它们的游泳速度和水陆两栖特质使它们对缺乏这些特质的敌人占据有利地形。血眼、喽啰和鳞齿会擒抱或束缚敌人使其困于水下，而恐怖蜥则在水面巡逻，猎杀任何胆敢逃脱的敌人。

现实世界灵感

许多蜥蜴人的特质和动作都源自现实世界中蜥蜴的生理结构。例如，角蜥在受威胁时会从眼中喷射血液，这启发了蜥蜴人血眼的血眼射线动作。飞蜥拥有由皮肤褶皱连接的肋骨，可以伸展和收缩形成翅膀，使它们能在树木间滑翔。恐怖蜥的设计灵感正是来源于飞蜥。

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.AlD29yxdMFLiVqEC]

美杜莎石化

在较低等级时,石化状态可能让角色永久退出游戏。如果你想给低等级角色一个在遭遇美杜莎后从石化中恢复的机会,确保附近有一座拥有能施展高等复原术的祭司的神殿...当然,需要付出代价。

美杜莎巢穴

美杜莎在阴影中寻求隐私和慰藉,通常占据孤寂山脉中的废弃废墟或拥有高耸天花板的洞穴。美杜莎受害者的雕像通常遍布该区域。

大型拟身怪

虽然拟身怪伪装成宝箱或衣柜是经典玩法,但当你加入能伪装成建筑物的巨型拟身怪时,绝对能让你的玩家们大吃一惊。想象一下走进一家酒馆想吃点东西,结果酒馆反而想吃了你!

如果你想使用能变形为巨型和超巨型物件的拟身怪,请使用@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.7XQrTOfdJPvH6HIY]资料卡,它与普通拟身怪相比有以下调整:

  • 该拟身怪拥有91(14d8 + 28)生命值和4(1,100 XP)挑战等级
  • 拟身怪的力量值为20(+5)
  • 拟身怪使用伪足和噬咬颌攻击时具有+7命中加值,每次攻击额外造成7(2d6)强酸伤害
  • 挣脱拟身怪擒抱和吞噬效果的DC为15
  • 变形生物特性允许拟身怪变成任何中型或更大的物件

只是门把手而已,对吧?

不是整扇门,就只是那个门把手。这小混蛋在我反应过来之前差点把我的手咬掉。

但你能怎么办?你总不能...停止开门吧。只能时刻准备迎接意外。

我知道这不是什么有用的建议。

— 太阳,高级纵火师,社会

奥洛塞克巢穴

无论是栖息在最深的海洋中,还是潜伏在类人生物国度里,奥洛塞克都会被缓慢侵蚀或灾难性变化所雕刻出的混乱洞穴所吸引。这类地点包括海底的古老钻孔,曾经宏伟建筑坍塌成的粘液浸透的废墟,或是地震或早已死去的怪物开辟出的洞穴。

内容警告:身体恐怖

大多数奥洛塞克是难以理解的邪恶生物,它们使用灵能力量重塑敌人的肉体。它们的资料卡包含强烈的身体恐怖元素。为了您和您的玩家的安全,您可以随意修改这些效果。

全视者伊苏拉斯

Orc Tactics

Orcs charge into battle, keeping foes close so that they can use their Relentless trait when the time comes. Orc blitzers surround as many foes as possible to make the most of their Gnashing Horde trait. Bloodrunners and furies also dive into melee combat, dishing out extra damage to targets they knock prone. Conduits, forcecallers, and terranovas get close to the action but avoid melee. Orc ramparts serve as protectors for these mages battling any who dare challenge the orc spellcasters.

An orc godcaller positions themself at the center of the battle so that they can heal and buff as many allies as possible, preferably with an orc rampart watching their back. Orc garroters enter the battle last to take advantage of the chaos. They typically arrive invisible so they can get advantage on the first Strangle attack they make.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.EuSw7JPbCsCecuOa]

Knock Them Prone

The bloodrunner, fury, terranova, mohler, and scyza all have features that can knock enemies prone. If the garroter knocks someone unconscious with a Strangle attack, odds are the target winds up prone as well! Knocking targets prone is especially helpful for the bloodrunner and the fury, since they can both deal extra damage to prone targets. These creatures were designed to work together.

Orc Magic Items

Even more so than other creatures, orcs benefit from magic items that increase their bonuses to attack and damage rolls, such as a wand of the war mage or even a simple +1 weapon. These items make the orc's Relentless trait more reliable and are good rewards for low-level player characters who defeat them.

Orcs also benefit from magic items that increase their speed and mobility, allowing them to always stay within striking distance of their targets. A cape of the mountebank and a potion of speed make excellent choices for an orc who wants to keep their enemies close.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.wYZJRAFmjbhaDDdl]

Wild Shape and Owlbears

Owlbears are awesome. These fluffy, furry, ferocious creatures have captured the hearts of players everywhere. Almost every GM is eventually asked by a player if their character can turn into an owlbear using the druid's Wild Shape class feature or the polymorph spell.

The official answer is no. Owlbears are Monstrosities, not Beasts (despite both owls and bears individually being Beasts), so that automatically disqualifies them as an option for the druid's Wild Shape feature and the polymorph spell. But saying no is denying a player a chance to do a cool thing, and doing cool things is a big part of many people's fun with this game. We want to give you the option of saying yes.

If you want to allow a player character to turn into an owlbear using Wild Shape or the polymorph spell, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.cxUcoljf65hJSN2N] stat block, a modified Owlbear stat block to which we have made the following changes:

  • The owlbear's Bear Hug action can be used once. The owlbear regains all uses when they finish a long rest.
  • The owlbear's Hulking Rush reaction can be used once. The owlbear regains all uses when they finish a long rest.

Time Raider Encounters

Time raiders are built to quickly get into a location, accomplish a task, and get out. Archons leave their foes dazed, making it difficult for enemies to chase the time raiders. Armingers knock foes prone and make their targets suffer disadvantage on attack rolls, so allies provoking opportunity attacks have a lower risk of taking damage as they move around the battlefield. The nemesis can move through walls and teleport around the battlefield, while the vertex excels at moving entire groups of allies with Invigorated March and Split Space.

Because time raiders are so mobile, they make perfect candidates for encounters that are about more than a fight to the last warrior. Time raiders are excellent adversaries in encounters involving chases, robberies, and kidnappings.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.7iyGs3zhc21CjZRr]

Mutated Trolls

At the GM's discretion, a troll can mutate after consuming the flesh of an alien, powerful, or supernaturally created creature, gaining some of their prey's damage immunities and resistances, traits, or actions. For instance, a troll who devours a blue dragon might gain the creature's immunity to lightning damage and Lightning Breath action. Be aware this can significantly increase the difficulty trolls present in combat — especially if their mutations deal more damage than normal or grant immunity to acid or fire damage.

A Wild Limbjumble Appears!

You can increase the difficulty and drama of a battle against trolls by having their severed body parts form limbjumbles. Whenever a troll takes 10 or more slashing damage from an attack or effect, a chunk of their body flies off and forms a limbjumble.

Making Incorporeal Undead

Though most incorporeal undead were once Humanoid, you can easily make spectral undead from any other creature type. First, choose the stat block you want to use for the undead: shade, shadow, specter, or wraith. Then adjust the stat block's size and Intelligence score to match the original creature's statistics. That's all you need to do to make an incorporeal undead version of a creature.

I dunno why it's always wraiths. Dealt with a lot of deathless, but wraiths are the worst. They're always pissed about something.

— Dancer, Chronicler of the Chain of Acheron, Heroes 216-231

Undead or Dead Dead?

Many lesser corporeal undead look no different than mundane remains when they're at rest. Keep the players on their toes by including a few mundane bodies in an undead-infested dungeon — or leave a pile of normal-looking corpses in aroom, only for them to be gone next time the adventurers enter.

Soulstone Rejuvenation

Most characters don't go up against a lich unprepared. By the time they face the villain in a final confrontation, characters (and their players) should understand how the lich's soulstone and Rejuvenation trait work. Since the soulstone can easily bring a lich back to life once the lich's soul is inside, the party's best shot at defeating them once and for all is to destroy the stone first, then kick some lich butt.

High Mage Vairae

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00highmagevair00 inline]

Content Warning: Body Horror

High Mage Vairae's Machinations of Bone action is gruesome and visceral. Not everyone enjoys that kind of body horror. If anyone at your table is uncomfortable with bone extraction, feel free to describe this action as spectral blades pressing in around Vairae's foes.

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.00vairaeimg00000 inline]

Content Warning: Body Horror

Flesh mournlings are conglomerations of many different creatures sewn together. If you or your players don't want such descriptions in your game, these mournlings could instead be made from plants or other natural material.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.debUb33EZTg8XqY1]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00fleshmournli00 inline]

Making a Mournling

If player characters wish to create a mournling to protect a wild habitat from destruction, they'll need to learn the secret creation rites — ones known only to the most secluded druid circles. The characters must journey to the home of one of these remote sects without harming the natural world. To characters who pass this first test, the druids offer a quest to prove the party's loyalty and love to nature. This quest usually involves battling those who seek to corrupt or harm the creatures of the wild.

Mummies.name: Mummies

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00mummies0000000 inline]

Ashyra, Keeper of the Crypt

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00ashyrakeeper00 inline]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.00ashyra00000000 cite=false]

Khorsekef the Infinite

Khorsekef the Infinite, First Pharaoh of the Khemharan Empire, ruled for over 3,000 years. Under his rule, the people of Khemhara thrived in the desert, and Khorsekef's power provided an oasis for an entire nation. What his people could not know, because the desert isolated them from the world, was that Khorsekef's rule denied them the right to change or grow. Though their god-king was human, he never died, and generation after generation turned to dust at his feet. Children were born, grew old, married, had children — but nothing ever changed. Names, likenesses, identities, and even discoveries were endlessly recycled.

The Khem-hor thought this was the cycle of the world, but the truth was hidden from them until the great explorer Lady Agatamori, from Higara, exposed it. In truth, powerful artifacts kept the Khem-hor trapped within a perpetual cycle that fueled the pharaoh's immortality. During the ensuing struggle against Lady Agatamori and the Khem-hor, Khorsekef was transformed into the timescape's most powerful mummy and trapped in the Abyssal Wasteland.

You can read more about Khorsekef and find his stat block in Kingdoms & Warfare.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.ZBF5faL47a6H6eKj]

In those days, the Chain was in service to Queen Nefrusheri. I dunno what she was queen of — probably Khemhara. I never bothered to ask. When your boss is an immortal mummy queen, the conversation tends to be pretty one-sided. “Yes ma'am” is about all I contribute.

— Dancer, Chronicler of the Chain of Acheron, Heroes 216-231

Vampires.name: Vampires
Vampires.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00vampires000000 inline]

Vampire Lairs

Vampire spawn hide anywhere they can avoid the sun, such as tombs, sewers, or cellars. True vampires build more lavish lairs — opulent manors, shadowed castles, and vast crypts spiraling beneath the earth. Vampire lords lair in blackened towers, hollowed moons, and private demiplanes where the light of day never reaches.

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00vampirelair000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.Mae8dEgaP3reenC6]

Count Rhodar von Glauer

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00countrhodarv00 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.00countrhodar000 inline]

Atypical Vampire Diet

Vampires thirst for the blood of the living, but not all feast upon innocent sapient creatures. Some live off the blood of animals, though most vampires, including the ones who practice drinking from animals, find the taste of beast blood disgusting. These vampires hold their proverbial noses and gulp the animal blood down, because to them the alternative is unconscionable.

Other vampires indulge their bloodthirst by drinking from the wicked. These undead become vigilantes or adventurers, hunting the corrupt in search of a meal. Some are venerated by their communities as heroes while others keep their undead nature a secret, revealing it only when they drink from the neck of an adversary.

Excerpt from the Chronicle of the Chain of Acheron

“In those days the Chain was in service to the Emperor Gaius VIII, third of the Five Crusading Emperors, and 27th Emperor of Caelia. Gaius continued the crusades started by his illustrious granduncle. Those were profitable days for the Chain, the Wheel, and the Gate. While the other Helltroopers waded into the deserts of Khoursir and Khemhara, we battled in the forests of Vaslor. We had it easy. I hate deserts.

“Thinking his vampiric power would save him, Count Rhodar von Glauer waited until he was fulsome in his strength before trying to extend his dark realm into Caelian territory. But we know how to deal with vampires. The black and gold standard of the von Glauer family reads, “I do the devil's work.” We can attest to that. We lost many souls to that long siege, but in the end, we staked him. An old woman howled at us saying, “He is the land!” but we hear that stuff all the time. We sacked his castle, burned his forest and orchards, and delivered his staff to the emperor. That was harder than it sounds. Finger had to drop it in one of his bottomless sacks to stop the mists from coming. What the emperor will do with it, I don't know. I fear that staff may hold more than the power to make the mist.”

— Dancer, Chronicler of the Chain of Acheron, Heroes 228

Absolute Evil

Voiceless talkers are evil sapient beings who engage in reprehensible and irredeemable acts of eugenics. While you can create exceptional synlirii who fight against such philosophies and practices, the voiceless talkers who participate in genetic experiments are unquestionably evil.

Psi-Tech

While most psi-tech weapons can be used only by voiceless talkers, a character using the talent class (from the MCDM supplement The Talent and Psionics) can use these weapons by gaining 1 strain each time they make an attack with one. A creature using a psi-tech ranged weapon uses Intelligence instead of Dexterity for attack and damage rolls.

Bestiary.name: Bestiary
Bestiary.text:
From swarms of spiders to ancient wyrms, the creatures who appear most often in your games are in this chapter. All the creatures are listed in alphabetical order. Most of the creature entries feature more than one stat block, providing different roles like action-oriented creatures, companions, minions, and retainers.

@Embed[inline Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.UIegxhffsE47F1i1]

The Timescape

The places, people, and other proper names in the lore of this book come from the timescape, the MCDM multiverse. Most of the creatures detailed in this book are found in Orden, a world of high fantasy and just one of the timescape's many planes (also called manifolds). Orden is also called the Mundane World. If you like what you're reading, you can find more lore about the timescape on the MCDM Patreon at mcdm.gg/patreon.

You can ignore any creature's lore if you wish to use their stat block in another way in your campaign.

Angulotls.name: Angulotls
Angulotls.text:
@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.VkwAC4knpbDUtzpk]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00angulotls00000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.dolgVdnYYPaqcuuN]

They like humans! Adults tend to freak them out a little. I don't think they realize tall humans are the same species as tiny humans!

— Pinna, Hedge Witch, Gravesford

Angulotl Tactics

Angulotls prefer to battle their foes in partially aquatic environments that include lots of vegetation or other places to hide. This allows the angulotls to leap from the water, attack, and then retreat into the murk or bushes. Marshes, swamps, and jungle rivers make ideal showdownlocations.

An angulotl slink can give combat an interesting twist if they grab a magic item away from a character with their Tongue Nab attack then retreat, changing a deadly showdown into a dynamic chase. Just give the characters afighting chance to get back any stolen goods!

Angulotl Magic Items

Angulotl value magic items that enhance their low Strength, such as gauntlets of ogre power and potions of giant strength. Some angulotl seers take great pleasure in brewing potions of growth and quaffing them whenever they need to intimidate a threat.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.8cW8FhVePMwHO5MF]

Animals.name: Animals
Animals.text:
I know it's a cliché, but they really are more afraid of you than you are of them. And it's their forest, remember!

— Pinna, Hedge Witch, Gravesford

Animals play a prominent role in every fantasy story and can be found in every environment. This section introduces new fantastical beasts and offers fresh takes on popular predators and companions.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.Z737tcePyamcZ03m]

Optional Features

The timescape holds many more animals than one book could possibly contain. To aid in customizing the animals in this section — or even creating new ones — some creatures are accompanied by tables of optional features you can add to their stat blocks. These features are often based on real-world creatures the stat block can represent, and the table gives examples of those creature varieties.

Challenge Rating Adjustments. If an optional feature increases a creature's challenge rating, this is indicated in parentheses at the end of that feature. If a creature's original CR was less than 1 and you select a feature that adds 1 to their CR, their CR increases to 1 regardless of whether their original CR was 0, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2.

Since optional features increase a creature's power, they shouldn't be added to a companion creature without the GM's permission. This applies even to features that don't impact their official challenge rating.

Repurposing Stat Blocks. You can use these tables to inspire the creation of various animals in your fantasy world — perhaps a certain island is home to bears who have webbed feet and can breathe underwater while hunting aquatic prey, or maybe a powerful devil is accompanied by an infernal lion who exhales gouts of flame.

You can also reflavor stat blocks and optional features to represent other real-world creatures. For example, an albatross isn't technically a bird of prey, but you can make an excellent albatross stat block by using a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.kr9aYfG0EjjbPDLm] with the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.HzZst44ZAlQ3m9G4] and @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.z4EPBDRroIv0yEix] features from the Optional Bird of Prey Features table. Similarly, the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.d1YUzLWpJASkIJ2g] stat block can be handily used for a jackal, fox (give a fennec fox the same features as a sand cat), or dhole (add the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.xjvvhcWHdpTcAoAD] and @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.Fqodw10Zrrm721IK] features).

Wild Shape and Optional Features

At the GM's discretion, the beasts presented in the “Animals” entry can be Wild Shape options for druids. A druid player should also get their GM's approval before adding any of the optional features to a creature's stat block. For instance, a GM might be fine with a druid turning into a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.kr9aYfG0EjjbPDLm] using the base stat block presented in this entry but not allow the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.AbnKcMZgB9rQOzHK] trait to be added to it.

Researched Options

Many of the optional features provided for the different animal stat blocks are based on the incredible abilities of critters from the real world. Sometimes the best ideas for fantasy come from the truly wild nature of reality. Do an internet search for an aye-aye and you'll see.

If you need inspiration for new creature traits and actions, research the surprising things that animals can do. You might be as shocked as we were when we learned that some bears can run more than 30 miles per hour and many wildcats can survive falls as high as four stories without injury.

Variant: Snowfox Familiar

Snowfoxes make clever, playful familiars for spellcasters seeking a winged traveling companion. Patient hunters and excellent scouts in any territory, they're particularly well adapted to the snowy tundra.

Familiar. The snowfox can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with their willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the snowfox senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. In addition, the snowfox can use the companion's proficiency bonus for ability checks, and the snowfox gains temporary hit points equal to the companion's proficiency bonus at the end of a long rest. Either creature can end the bond at any time.

Animal Handling in the Wild

While Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks are typically limited to influencing trained or domesticated animals, you can lift this restriction to allow your characters to attempt to influence wild animals, such as a hungry panther who sees the party as dinner. Allowing the Animal Handling skill to influence wild beasts increases the versatility of a skill with a very limited number of uses in a typical game. It may be that you allow any character to attempt to use the skill to influence wild animals or that you restrict this special use to specific characters connected to nature, like druids and rangers.

If you do allow Animal Handling to be used to influence wild animals, remember that skills aren't magic. The same way a single successful Charisma (Persuasion) check isn't likely to turn a hostile bandit who wants to kill you into an ally ready to fight by your side, a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check can't turn a wolf the barbarian just punched in the face into a loyal pet. But it might convince the wolf to scurry off in search of easier prey.

Petrification Is Death

A permanent petrified condition can take a low-level character out of the game like death. Some players might not like that a creature with a challenge rating of 3 can knock them out of the story. That's why the basilisk has the Alchemical Ingredients trait. Remove this trait for a more dangerous basilisk.

Reversing Petrification

Petrification usually can't be reversed without the greater restoration spell or similarly powerful magic. However, the basilisk companion's Lesser Petrifying Eye Beams are weaker than that of most basilisks, allowing it to be countered with a cure ailment power or lesser restoration spell.

Bugbears.name: Bugbears
Bugbears.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00bugbears000000 inline]

@embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.V7WP57Ji0mKUusfJ]

Bugbear Encounters

While bugbears work well together, each has unique traits and actions that bolster their allies. Using multiple types of bugbears at once can increase the GM's mental load and make it easy to forget things in combat. Before running a combat with three different bugbears, you may wish to get a feel for how they affect battle by trying one bugbear with other allies, like goblins or hobgoblins.

Bugbear Tactics

Most bugbears prefer to start a fight with an ambush. They pick a spot where they know their foe will pass through, set the area with traps, then hide with their allies and wait. When it's time to strike, a bugbear positions themself and moves as necessary so that as many allies as possible benefit from their Bugbear's Inspiration trait.

When commanding others, bugbears coordinate their allies to focus fire on healers first so that the rest of their foes go down more quickly. If losing a battle, bugbears retreat to a secondary location, where they can hide and spring out to gain the upper hand against any pursuers. These secondary locations are stocked with potions and ammunition and guarded by traps.

Bugbear Magic Items

Bugbears benefit from magic items that enhance their stealth capabilities, such as the cloak of elvenkind or potion of invisibility. Since bugbears position themselves in battle to be close to their allies, magic items that provide benefits to nearby companions, such as the rod of alertness or a spell scroll of mass healing word, make excellent choices.

Bugbears are generous with their magic items. Before a battle, a bugbear may lend or even gift one of their items to an ally who can make better use of it. During a fight, a bugbear might toss a potion or magic weapon to a cornered ally. A bugbear whose defeat is imminent could quickly cast off a magic shield or scroll so a friend can grab the item before their enemies.

Demons.name: Demons
Demons.text:
@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.sqyLgGEKjeA9Qh1L]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00demons00000000 inline]

Demons and Souls

Demons feast not on food or water, but on souls. These fuel their bloodthirsty powers, and while starved for souls, a demon can scarcely think.

Soul Count

A demon's stat block states the number of souls a given demon has already consumed at the beginning of combat. This number is presented right under their hit points in a similar fashion.

You can adjust the formula used for the initial number of souls a demon has by unlocking an NPC sheet. You can then click the "Formula" button to roll the amount automatically.

You can use this feature for Demons of your own making by enabling it in the "Special Traits" menu!

Soul Devourer

Demons can gain more souls by slaying other creatures, as described in their Soul Devourer trait. Unlike hit points, there is no maximum limit to a demon's soul count.

Soul-Fueled Power

Most demons have one or more features that require souls to use.

Passive Traits. Passive traits automatically take effect after a demon's soul count crosses the threshold described in that trait. The trait remains active until the demon's soul count drops below the threshold, and the trait reactivates when the demon's soul count equals or exceeds it.

Active Features. During an encounter, a demon can burn souls to use or enhance certain abilities. When they do, their soul count decreases by the number indicated. This cost is sometimes noted in parentheses at the beginning of an ability, such as “(Costs 1 Soul).” Other times, the text of the ability itself describes it, such as saying “the demon can burn 1 soul” for an additional effect.

Lethe

When a demon's soul count drops to 0, they fall into a state known as lethe — a violent hunger wherein they can only lash out in a desperate search for sustenance. Demons who have fallen into lethe become single-minded and violent, seeking only to consume. See a demon's Lethe trait for more information.

Soulsight

Demons have a special sense called soulsight, allowing them to perceive each creature, other than Constructs and Undead, within a certain radius. Soulsight doesn't rely on sight but counts as “seeing” for features that require sight. Neither physical objects (including total cover) nor supernatural effects can impede soulsight unless otherwise stated. A demon's stat block lists the radius of their soulsight under “Senses.”

Adjusting Lethality

Soul devouring makes demons deadly opponents. To give characters a better chance of living through their encounter with a demon, you can reduce the DC of the saving throw — or you can remove the saving throw entirely, and only allow a demon to devour a soul when a creature dies within 60 feet of them through other means. On the other hand, you might like to scale up the deadliness with more powerful demons! If so, instead of always using a DC 11 saving throw, you can set the DC equal to 8 + the demon's proficiency bonus.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.dSUAyN1Eo3zjiy5x]

Demonic Hierarchy

Mortal scholars classify demons in nine categories — the higher a demon's category, the more powerful the fiend. Though demons don't use these classifications themselves, scholars are correct that demons have a hierarchy, as stronger demons bully the weak into service.

Each time a demon consumes a soul, there's a chance they may evolve into a more powerful demon. Though Category 1 demons typically become Category 2 demons after consuming just one soul, there's no known pattern to how more powerful demons evolve. For example, some Category 2 demons evolve to Category 3 after consuming just one soul, while others must devour thousands before earning a promotion. This evolution can be instant, or it can take years. This inconsistency has led to much scholarly debate on whether all souls are equal, or whether these evolutions are aided by consuming souls that are especially corrupt or heroic.

The following sections describe the most common types of Category 1-5 demons, though there are many other types of demons within these categories.

Pitling

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00pitling0000000 inline]

Ruinant

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00ruinant0000000 inline]

Category 6 and Beyond

After devouring thousands of souls, a demon who reaches Category 6 develops a unique form and individual identity — the latter of which persists through future evolutions. These ancient demons thrive in the brutal chaos of the Abyss, each commanding a squad of bloodthirsty fiends.

Category 9 demons — the demon lords — are the most powerful. Their names are whispered carefully, their power rivals the gods', and their schemes ruin worlds.

Aurumvas of Meaningless Greed

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00aurumvasofme00 inline]

Teleporting Aurumvas

Aurumvas's Greed Is Good bonus action allows him to teleport all over the battlefield. By the time the characters are ready to face him in a mortal showdown, each likely has at least a few expensive magic items or pieces of equipment worth at least 100 gp. That allows Aurumvas to teleport to the most vulnerable and unprotected foe each round and unleash his Greedy Hands attacks upon them.

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.7ll2jYHvDN4E8YWU cite=false]

Devils.name: Devils
Devils.text:
@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.I4uFhXqlydONip6r]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00devils00000000 inline]

Infernal Chancellor Lazivos

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00infernalchan00 inline]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.PFVqiBuVp7zmiL8s cite=false]

Summoning Devils

Ritually summoning a devil is not to be taken lightly. These rituals are costly and dangerous, and those determined to see it through are typically desperate, driven, or simply foolish. This section explains the rules for summoning devils, the costs involved, and the consequences of such a ritual.

The Ritual

To perform a ritual to summon a devil, a creature must meet the following requirements.

Material Components. The ritual requires the following material components, which are consumed regardless of whether the ritual succeeds:

  • 500 gp worth of brimstone
  • 500 gp worth of obsidian
  • 250 gp worth of magical incense, chalk, and candles
  • 125 gp worth of Celestial blood, blessed by a priest (if such blood is unavailable, the priest can bless 250 gp worth of Humanoid blood in its place)

Personal Sacrifice. A creature who attempts to summon a devil must sacrifice their vitality as follows, regardless of whether the ritual succeeds:

  • The summoner rolls a number of d10s equal to their level or challenge rating (minimum of 1) and loses hit points equal to the result.
  • The summoner also expends half their maximum Hit Dice with no effect. (If the summoner has less than half their maximum Hit Dice available, they can't perform this ritual until they regain enough Hit Dice.) Hit Dice expended in this way can't be regained until the greater restoration spell is cast on the summoner twice within the same hour, or by means of a wish spell.

Ritual Length. When summoning a devil, a creature can perform either an instantaneous or hour-long ritual.

A desperate creature can use their action to perform an instantaneous ritual, which has a greater chance of failure. However, the exacting steps performed in an hour-long ritual reduce the summon check DC by 3.

True Name. A creature who knows a devil's true name can speak it aloud when performing the ritual. Invoking a devil's true name reduces the summon check DC by 5, and if the ritual succeeds, it summons the specific devil whose name was spoken.

Summon Check. To finish the ritual, a creature must make a summon check. This is a DC 18 Charisma check, though the DC decreases if the summoner performs an hour-long ritual or uses a devil's true name. @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00best01.JournalEntryPage.00devils00000000#ritual-consequences]{Ritual Consequences} details the results of a successful or failed summon check.

Another creature can assist the summoner with the ritual by taking the Help action. They are branded with the same infernal rune as the summoner, as described in @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00best01.JournalEntryPage.00devils00000000#ritual-consequences]{Ritual Consequences}.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.ihCb7YdQ4vuFs6rr]

Ritual Consequences

Succeed or fail, summoning a devil has weighty consequences.

Branded. Succeed or fail, a creature who attempts or assists in a summoning ritual is branded by an infernal rune on a prominent part of their body, such as their head, chest, or back. This rune marks them as someone who has tried to summon a devil. Communities and individuals who recognize the meaning of the rune may treat the summoner with fear, suspicion, or contempt.

Success. If a creature succeeds on the summon check, roll on or choose from the Summoned Devil table to determine what type of devil is summoned (unless the summoner spoke a devil's true name during the ritual, thereby summoning that specific devil). At the GM's discretion, other devil types can be summoned instead.

A successful ritual binds the devil to a contract with the summoner. The devil must help the summoner with a specific task, such as finishing the current battle or aiding in a single quest objective. At the GM's discretion, a devil may be willing to extend the contract, but this has additional consequences for the summoner's soul and requires further payment, often in the form of favors.

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.tables.RollTable.erHhZL4gCetRqfZn caption=false rollable]

Failure. If a creature fails the summon check by 4 or fewer, no devil is summoned.

If a creature fails the summon check by 5 or more, a devil is summoned as in the “Success” section, but the fiend isn't contractually bound to the summoner and can act as they please. At the GM's discretion, the devil could still offer a contract — one that asks much of the summoner.

If a creature fails the summon check by 10 or more, they suffer the consequences of failing by 5 or more, and an additional planar entity — such as a demon, an Elemental, or a Celestial — is also summoned. This additional entity is hostile toward the summoner.

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.fJM8xXzDb7Py3ALg]

Finding Components and True Names

Most of the material components required for summoning devils can be purchased at churches or magic shops. The characters might also come across these components in a cult hideout, an abandoned wizard's tower, or the lair of any creature who has cause to consort with fiends.

Characters might discover a devil's true name in a dusty tome after months of research, or they could hear it from the lips of a lesser devil with a score to settle. If you're using the domain rules in Kingdoms & Warfare, the characters can discover a devil's true name with a successful Lore test (DC equals 10 + the devil's challenge rating).

In the end we got Zalkith's devil-lieutenant to switch sides. We were lucky; Chance is a devilkin. She did all the talking. After the fight, the lieutenant wanted to broker some agreement, but we're not stupid. First rule of dealing with devils — don't sign anything.

— Dancer, Chronicler of the Chain of Acheron, Heroes 216-231

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.tables.RollTable.tacOVqjBDuhnH4ps caption=false rollable]

Variant: Dragonet Familiar

Particularly adventurous dragonets are eager to accompany spellcasters as their companions or familiars. Dragonets tend to be curious, gregarious, and fiercely loyal to their chosen companions. Those who hope to befriend a dragonet should take note that their preferred foods are fresh fruit and fish (raw, seared, or smoked) — though dragonets introduced to humanoid delicacies also become particularly fond of spiced or sweetened nuts.

Familiar. The dragonet can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with their willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the dragonet senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. In addition, when the dragonet uses their Truesight action, their companion also has truesight while in physical contact with the dragonet. Either creature can end the bond at any time.

Dragons.name: Dragons
Dragons.text:
@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00dragons0000000 inline]

Campaign Bosses

We made the choice to give you five serious ancient wyrms in this book instead of a greater number of unremarkable dragon stat blocks because every dragon battle should be memorable. Each dragon presented here can serve as the villain at the end of a campaign. Of course, some industrious GMs will find a way to tie all the dragons into their story. (Yes, that is a friendly challenge.)

Durixaviinox

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00durixaviinox00 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.eislsKqBb4V8C6dE cite=false]

Forzaantilirys

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00forzaantilir00 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.VWA2qgNeLYMtEVrD cite=false]

She'd destroy the world — herself included. They're all like that, the noble dragons. Draco Draconis. They're so old, pain is all they know.

— Lady Demelza, Courser

Qazyldrath

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00qazyldrath0000 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.L6dvYhu6xFUGGURr cite=false]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00xaantikorije00 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.RwMZAvzBijMgMw8C cite=false]

Yserthrax

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00yserthrax00000 inline] @Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.MW3oHt8E9VZX0km6 cite=false]

Dragon Tactics

Dragons seek lairs with lofty ceilings (or none at all) so they can use one of their greatest defenses: flight. A dramatic encounter with a dragon can quickly become a slog if the wyrm lands and never moves around the battlefield. Dragons are smart! They know to use their long reach and breath weapon to make life difficult for their enemies.

Dragons choose extremely defensible places for their lairs, which are part home and part treasure vault. The wyrms rely on loyal guardians and an environment that is inhospitable to mortal treasure hunters and would-be heroes. For instance, Forzaantilirys makes her home in Mount Brazen, an enormous volcano that is hotter than the Seven Cities of Hell. Her treasure sits on an obsidian island floating in a lake of lava in the heart of the mountain. Just walking through the tunnels to reach Forzaantilirys's hoard would bake most people to death.

Yserthrax and Morrax grappled.
Her heart he sought to kill.
Morrax fought.
Morrax died.
And Yserthrax lives still.

— Last stanza from the Tale of Morrax Qor, SteelDwarf Hero, from the Codex Valiar

Introduction.name: Introduction
Introduction.text:
Mummies lurk in tombs, but what other dangers wait in the crypt's darkness? Which monsters lurk in the enchanted forest that adventurers must cross to reach their destination? What new traits does a sewer-dwelling owlbear gain?

This section presents eight typical adventure environments and a handful of creatures found within each. These environments aren't necessarily biomes, though some biomes are included here. Each environment is the kind of place the player characters might enter or pass through while seeking adventure, such as roads or swamps, or the underground world below the surface of the Mundane World.

@Embed[inline Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.vpbQzfbGexc3PgbF]

For each of the biomes mentioned in Flee, Mortals!, a scene has been created and can be found in the "Environments" compendium. You can use these to quickly generate an encounter in the favored terrain!

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.WMi6Fw6TnfEpukcN]{Cave}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.cDIgm7XaFIowuCHI]{Enchanted Forest} / @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.jJEsJXz1Bzthfw6t]{Enchanted Forest Dark} / @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.fm2uOgp4jh3fNKHe]{Enchanted Forest Light}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.7OdMLZXKoy9JEy9u]{Graveyard & Tomb}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.OEI5Zxch2VSt43xa]{Road}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.jAUyUxamLnE4WkaP]{Ruined Keep Map 1} / @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.MfMD1oYeRUmgCnCk]{Ruined Keep Map 2}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.MSyY170GBDoq5YJS]{Sewer}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.EfrAMHA18HQTsIKq]{Swamp}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.scenes.Scene.HnJJ6F3BWVQIkBTn]{Underground}

Environmental Features

Most of the environments in this book provide traits and lair actions you can give to creatures who live there. These traits and lair actions are designed to work with creatures of any challenge rating; as a result, they often don't use static numbers for things like damage dice and save DCs. Instead, this book sometimes calls for you to use the creature's proficiency bonus (abbreviated as PB).

For example, when a creature deals damage, they might use a number of dice equal to the creature's proficiency bonus. If a creature has a +3 proficiency bonus and their trait “deals PBd10 force damage,” that's 3d10 force damage.

Similarly, when a feature requires a saving throw, the DC might add the creature's proficiency bonus. If a creature has a +3 proficiency bonus and their trait calls for a “DC 12 plus PB Dexterity saving throw,” that's a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw.

Cave.name: Cave
Cave.text:
Some caves are simple holes in a mountainside, while others are cavernous recesses cutting through the bowels of the earth — but all are a source of fascination, fear, and adventure. As all savvy adventurers know, caves can contain treasures untold or a death most unceremonious. Beware the dark.

Cave Traits

Enchanted Forest.name: Enchanted Forest
Enchanted Forest.text:
He who has no dreams, let him go to a beautiful forest to have many.

— Mehmet Murat Ildan

Magic permeates nature. From fulminating thunderstorms to nurturing berries, nature answers when adventurers seek its verdant potency. Where planar veils are thin, ancient spirits dwell, or ley lines emanate wild energy, enchanted forests await with mesmerizing creatures and mysteries.

Enchanted Forest Traits

You can create an enchanted forest version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.NqRChszCbaBt7vjv]

Revealing a Bonestalker

Bonestalkers are cryptids — their chilling legend, unsolved murders, and unconfirmed existence add to the terror they might inflict on adventurers. You can lead characters through an investigation of mysterious murders surrounding a forest village… then have the bonestalker pull out the victims' skulls during the fight, and let the characters connect the dots.

More Skulls!

At your discretion, a bonestalker isn't limited to the skulls they start combat with. They can pick up skulls on the battlefield and use those as further fuel for their abilities.

Dancing Lady

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00dancinglady000 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.18zxcNwuw7dfxdJn]

Empyrean Stag

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00empyreanstag00 inline]

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.fLkR2PbVHvEK9VM3]

Good-Aligned Enemies

It can be difficult to know when to deploy creatures who are typically good-aligned as enemies for the characters to fight. That's why there aren't many in this book. However, these creatures still have agendas that can bring them into conflict with the characters. For instance, the empyrean stag protects enchanted forests from violent invaders, and if the characters do battle with any creature native to the forest, it draws the stag's ire.

Graveyard and Tomb.name: Graveyard and Tomb
Graveyard and Tomb.text:
Only human graveyards are haunted, have you ever thought about that? There's something about us, about death. It's not dying, there's something about being alive we haven't figured out. If we knew how to live, maybe we wouldn't be so angry when we're dead.

— Lady Demelza, Courser

Adventurers who enter graveyards and ancient tombs often do so to keep the dead at rest, stop necromancy rituals, or consult the ghosts of wise sages and heroes of the past.

Graveyard and Tomb Traits

You can create a graveyard or tomb version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.at6rzlLBGcQupoXv inline]

Road.name: Road
Road.text:
Oh do not leave the road! Especially if there's like a hundred yards between the road and the forest? That is 100% ankheg territory.

— Pinna, Hedge Witch, Gravesford

When people travel well-patrolled thoroughfares and live in sleepy hamlets, it's easy to believe that adventure is something that happens far away. But the wealth and assumed security of settled lands make them rich pickings for predators of all sorts — particularly those who can disguise their sinister natures or hide beneath the roads.

Ruined Keep.name: Ruined Keep
Ruined Keep.text:
Whether a crumbling wizard's tower or the lonely outpost of a long-since-forgotten kingdom, the ruined keep can be found in any environment. These crumbling structures might be decrepit, but they are rarely abandoned.

Ruined Keep Traits

You can create a ruined keep version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.8k8NUa3uHS9l2s0B]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.XhlHqVYCvCO8EMEL]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.wbulEAuhdxiKyKl0]

@Embed[inline Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.xY0gt03QPwvG9h9h]

Ruined Keep Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.QhosJuBxMy26ETVA inline]

Express Descent Goes Deep

Some players and GMs enjoy that the Express Descent lair action can drop characters into a new level of the keep, while others feel this makes tracking combat difficult and puts a lot of work on the GM. If you'd like to simplify where a creature who falls through the floor winds up, you can have them fall into a 10-foot-deep pit. A fallen creature takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage from the fall and lands prone, and they can climb out of the pit without making an ability check.

Former Purpose

A ruined keep once had a purpose. Was it built to protect the region from invaders, house a ruler's vast wealth, or serve as an arcane laboratory? The keep's former purpose can inspire you with ideas about the creatures and objects that currently reside there. You can choose or roll for the purpose of a ruin on the Keep Former Purposes table.

Sewer.name: Sewer
Sewer.text:
Sewer's as good a way to get into a city as any. Better in some ways. No more dangerous than any forest.

— Lady Demelza, Courser

Deep beneath the city streets, winding tunnels holding murky waters have been built above decaying secrets. In this dripping darkness, strange creatures grow fatter — and deadlier — on the toxic byproducts of civilization.

Sewer Traits

You can create a sewer version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@Embed[cite=false Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.tGoDnqCp76OGytIQ]

Gross Smells

Sewers smell like poop. It's kind of their whole deal. You can use the following optional rule to help evoke the sewer's grossness and make it a more challenging environment for the player characters. At the end of each hour a character who needs to breathe spends in the sewer, they must succeed on a [[/save dc=14 ability=con]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 hour or until they leave the sewer and remain outside of it for 10 minutes.

Fungus Creatures

This book introduces a new Fungus tag, which you can see in the metadata line of some Plant stat blocks. At your discretion, you can add this tag to other creatures in the core rules, such as the violet fungus. This tag applies to some traits in this book, like the rotbeast's Forest Rot and Rotwake traits.

We also implemented this tag for clarity. While science makes a distinction between fungi and plants, the game's core rules puts all fungus-based and plant-based creatures into the same Plant creature type. It makes sense that the official designers of the game wouldn't want to get too noodly with their creature types, but it turns out that many folks who are MCDM fans are also fungus fans! We had multiple people write to us and ask why we were calling fungi plants, so we decided a new tag would help clear things up.

Swamp.name: Swamp
Swamp.text:
Whatever horrors you think you've seen in the world, they pale beside the nightmares birthed in the swamp.

Whether exploring forgotten ruins, seeking a rare herbal remedy, or facing a powerful black dragon, adventurers should beware the unknown when entering the damp, dense wilds of a swamp. These isolated biomes are neither patient nor forgiving to strangers.

Swamp Traits

You can create a swamp version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.cobe9o507oLmLSah]

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.pBxzTsiQbA9OW82R]

@Embed[inline Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe09.JournalEntryPage.YYVQnnaB6xoFng5s]

Swamp Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.Zhn2ArqTXqfpVomI inline]

Swampy Terrain

You can use this optional rule for combat encounters in swampy terrain. Swampy terrain is difficult terrain. If a creature without a swimming speed ends their turn without moving, they are &reference[restrained]. A creature can use an action to make a [[/skill skill=athletics/acrobatics 14]] check, freeing themself or another creature they can reach from the swampy terrain on a success.

Bog Body

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00bogbody0000000 inline]

Marsh Hydra

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00marshhydra0000 inline]

Big Ball of Snakes

Before there was the marsh hydra, there was the big ball of snakes. When we first started working on the swamp environment, we created a creature that was just an enormous swarm of different snakes all entangled together in one ball, rolling through the swamp looking for a meal. This stat block was simply called the big ball of snakes.

We had a lot of laughs about that idea but ultimately decided the big ball of snakes was just too silly for this particular book. The design team still really liked the stat block's mechanics, so we changed the lore and adjusted some language and, voilà, the marsh hydra was born.

Underground.name: Underground
Underground.text:
Manifold 11, the World Below, the Dark Under All, is a world of caves and wine-dark seas. There is no sky there — no sun.

— Remainer

The vast cavernous depths of the World Below are places of danger and wonder, filled with odd denizens who have adapted to life in the dark. From skittering predators to deadly fungi, threats lurk in the shadows, ready to ambush unwary adventurers.

Underground Traits

You can create an underground version of an existing creature by adding one or more of the following traits to their stat block:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.aciFXABsKRlk0zOS]

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.GKvkapzOPYSkDsGi inline]

Deep Dreamer

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe03.JournalEntryPage.00deepdreamer000 inline]

Encountering a Deep Dreamer

There are two typical setups for deep dreamer encounters. The first is a deep dreamer with a bevy of creatures charmed by the fungus who fight to protect the dreamer. The other is a lone dreamer floating in the darkness above the characters, releasing spores in an attempt to charm them before any fighting begins.

Dazed.name: Dazed
Dazed.text:
A dazed creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action. If a creature becomes dazed during their turn, their turn ends. The cure ailment power, lesser restoration spell, and greater restoration spell remove the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, other powers, spells, or effects might also remove the dazed condition.

When a dazed creature is affected by a spell or effect that gives them an extra action on their turn (like the haste spell or the fighter's Action Surge feature), they can still take this extra action, in addition to the movement, action, or bonus action allowed by the dazed condition.

Some creatures in this book have immunity to the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, a creature published in the core rules or another supplement who has immunity to the paralyzed or stunned condition also has immunity to the dazed condition.
Dazed.tooltip:
A dazed creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action. If a creature becomes dazed during their turn, their turn ends. The cure ailment power, lesser restoration spell, and greater restoration spell remove the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, other powers, spells, or effects might also remove the dazed condition.

When a dazed creature is affected by a spell or effect that gives them an extra action on their turn (like the haste spell or the fighter's Action Surge feature), they can still take this extra action, in addition to the movement, action, or bonus action allowed by the dazed condition.

Some creatures in this book have immunity to the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, a creature published in the core rules or another supplement who has immunity to the paralyzed or stunned condition also has immunity to the dazed condition.

Flanked.name: Flanked
Flanked.text: If your game uses the optional flanking rules in the core rules, a creature who is immune to the flanked condition can't be flanked regardless of the position of their enemies.
Flanked.tooltip: If your game uses the optional flanking rules in the core rules, a creature who is immune to the flanked condition can't be flanked regardless of the position of their enemies.

Caregiver.name: Caregiver
Caregiver.text:
Every companion has a player character caregiver who commands the creature. The caregiver's player controls the companion most of the time during the game, though the GM can step in to take control if the companion and caregiver are separated, or if the caregiver mistreats the companion in some way.

In combat, a companion shares a turn with their caregiver and acts during the caregiver's turn. A companion can move and use their own reaction and bonus action independently. But they can take only the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions unless their caregiver uses a bonus action to command the companion to take a different action, including any of the actions noted in the companion's stat block. A companion must be able to see or hear their caregiver to receive a command. A companion can also take other actions if their caregiver is incapacitated or if thecompanion enters a rampage (asdiscussed below).

Charmed Caregiver

A caregiver who is charmed can still command their companion, but they can't command the companion to attack acreature who charmed them.

Incapacitated or Absent Caregiver

If a companion's caregiver is incapacitated or dies, the GMdetermines who controls the companion — typically, the caregiver's player can maintain control of their companion as they take a heroic stand against the enemy.

However, in cases where a caregiver and their companion are physically separated, such as when acompanion is captured, the GM might wish to take controlof the companion to keep the player in suspenseabout the creature's fate.

New Caregiver

At the GM's discretion, a companion can abandon a caregiver character and choose a different willing creature as a caregiver.

The caregiver's player controls the companion most of the time during the game, though the GM can step in to take control if the companion and caregiver are separated, or if the caregiver mistreats the companion in some way.

Ambusher.name: Ambusher
Ambusher.text: Ambushers are creatures who hide well — not just before an encounter, but during it. They utilize surprise and stealth to gain the upper hand.
Ambusher.tooltip: Ambushers are creatures who hide well — not just before an encounter, but during it. They utilize surprise and stealth to gain the upper hand.

Artillery.name: Artillery
Artillery.text: Artillery creatures fight best from afar. Whether they wield arrows or magical rays, these creatures always try to keep a distance from their foes.
Artillery.tooltip: Artillery creatures fight best from afar. Whether they wield arrows or magical rays, these creatures always try to keep a distance from their foes.

Brute.name: Brute
Brute.text: Brutes are hardy creatures who have lots of hit points and deal lots of damage. They might not be the most disciplined warriors, but they make up for it with sheer toughness and aggression.
Brute.tooltip: Brutes are hardy creatures who have lots of hit points and deal lots of damage. They might not be the most disciplined warriors, but they make up for it with sheer toughness and aggression.

Companion.name: Companion
